summary.para: A base class representing an HTTP entity body and content headers.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task CopyToAsync (System.IO.Stream stream);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CopyToAsync(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been written to the stream object passed as the parameter.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content into a stream of bytes and copies it to the stream object provided as the parameter.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been written to the stream object passed as the parameter.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content into a stream of bytes and copies it to the stream object provided as the parameter.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

Docs.param: Information about the transport (channel binding token, for example). This parameter may be null.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.IO.Stream> CreateContentReadStreamAsync ();
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class System.IO.Stream> CreateContentReadStreamAsync() cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been written to the memory stream.

Once the operation completes, the property on the returned task object contains the memory stream that that represents the HTTP content. The returned stream can then be used to read the content using various stream APIs.

The method buffers the content to a memory stream. Derived classes can override this behavior if there is a better way to retrieve the content as stream. For example, a byte array or a string could use a more efficient method way such as wrapping a read-only around the bytes or string.)

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content to a memory stream as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

summary.para: Releases the unmanaged resources and disposes of the managed resources used by the .

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

remarks.para: This method is called by the public Dispose() method and the method. Dispose() invokes the protected Dispose(Boolean) method with the parameter set to true. invokes Dispose with set to false.When the parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. This method invokes the Dispose() method of each referenced object.

summary.para: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally disposes of the managed resources.

Docs.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to releases only unmanaged resources.

.property instance class System.Net.Http.Headers.HttpContentHeaders Headers

summary.para: Gets the HTTP content headers as defined in RFC 2616.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task LoadIntoBufferAsync ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task LoadIntoBufferAsync() cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been serialized to the memory buffer.
After content is serialized to a memory buffer, calls to one of the methods will copy the content of the memory buffer to the target stream.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content to a memory buffer as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task LoadIntoBufferAsync (long maxBufferSize);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task LoadIntoBufferAsync(int64 maxBufferSize) cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been serialized to the memory buffer.
After content is serialized to a memory buffer, calls to one of the methods will copy the content of the memory buffer to the target stream.
If the content exceeds the value passed in the parameter , an exception is thrown.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content to a memory buffer as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

Docs.param: The maximum size, in bytes, of the buffer to use.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<byte[]> ReadAsByteArrayAsync ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<unsigned int8[]> ReadAsByteArrayAsync() cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been written as a byte array.
Once the operation completes, the property on the returned task object contains the byte array with the HTTP content.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content to a byte array as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<System.IO.Stream> ReadAsStreamAsync ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class System.IO.Stream> ReadAsStreamAsync() cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the stream that represents content has been read.

Once the operation completes, the property on the returned task object contains the stream that that represents the HTTP content. The returned stream can then be used to read the content using various stream APIs.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content and return a stream that represents the content as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<string> ReadAsStringAsync ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<string> ReadAsStringAsync() cil managed

remarks.para: This operation will not block. The returned object will complete after all of the content has been written as a string.
Once the operation completes, the property on the returned task object contains the string with the HTTP content.

summary.para: Serialize the HTTP content to a string as an asynchronous operation.

returns.para: The task object representing the asynchronous operation.
